item.title: CK Goldiing explores 'telephobia'
item.description:
It's the fear of making, or getting, a phone call. Spotify signs some influencers, and APM has an intriguing announcement.
Visit https://podnews.net/update/telephobia for all the links, and to subscribe.
item.content:encoded:
Visit https://podnews.net/update/telephobia for all the links, and to subscribe.

Our cover story: CK Goldiing from the Worry About It Later Podcast, in our podcast news section, below.

  • American Public Media and reVolverpodcasts have announced they're to make Spanish language podcasts. Brains On en Español will be their first release: "available exclusively on a major podcast platform that will be announced this fall." Hmm. Does it begin with A?
  • Podcast host Fireside has launched the Fireside Pro Plan, which they describe as a "plan for podcasters who are becoming serious about their show". The plan includes a number of collaboration features and enhanced analytics.
  • Acast has launched a feature allowing listeners to rate podcasts in the Acast app. Since launching this month, people have left more than 45,000 in-app ratings for 9,000 different shows. (We list how to add your podcast to the Acast app and many others).

Classifieds - your job or ad here

Black Man befriends the Ku Klux Klan ? — Amidst everything going on, I think we can all agree that we need all hands on deck to fight this disease called racism. Discover how & why Daryl Davis (a black man) befriended members of the KKK

Book A Podcast Studio Near You — Top podcast recording studios are listed on Podcast Rental and are ready to help produce your next episode. Peruse the listings and request a booking today!

Freedom Brokers Subscribe Now! — Insight from today’s toP players in the defense community. Trainers, action sports and outdoor icons.

  • Podcast Day Online takes place on October 26: a virtual version of the popular cross-Europe podcast event. Speakers include Earlonne Woods from Ear Hustle, Julie Shapiro from Radiotopia, Steve Pratt of Pacific Content, and our Editor. Want money off? Use this code: PODONLINE20
  • Want free promotion for your podcast? International Podcast Day 2020 is on September 30th; as a gold sponsor, Podiant wants to showcase your show during their session.
  • Honouring the best of the European Internet, The Lovie Awards are still open for entries: if you thought you'd missed the opportunity to enter their eleven new podcast categories, they've a grace period until 25 September.
  • Spotify has announced its latest content deal with "the internet’s longtime favorite comedic personalities and fashion & lifestyle icons Rickey Thompson and Denzel Dion" for an upcoming podcast series.
  • Lemonada Media is switching from Westwood One to Stitcher's Midroll for ad sales.
  • Westwood One has picked up Inside of You, a podcast with Smallville actor Michael Rosenbaum.
  • Headliner is now integrated with Blubrry.
  • Based in Philly? The Philadelphia Podcasting Society is conducting an online census to understand how it can better help podcasters during the pandemic.
  • A nice tweak: when you get your podcast listed in Spotify for Podcasters, they now give you the link it'll be on, reports Solid Gold Podcast Studios, who've just launched language and literature podcast The Reading Room.
  • The Economist posts in this week's issue that Podcasting provides a space for free thought in China. (Your library may make The Economist free for you, via the RBDigital app).

Tips and tricks

  • 8 ways publishers are making money from podcasts (Media Voices Podcast, Esther Kezia Thorpe)
  • How to find and book guests for your podcast (Pacific Content)

Podcast News

  • Are you afraid of having to make a phone call? It's called telephobia, and a podcaster in the UK has explored it by ringing people at random. The Worry About It Later Podcast is hosted by CK Goldiing, an award-winning creator, writer & filmmaker.
  • Pop Culture Happy Hour, NPR’s entertainment and pop culture round-table podcast, is to go daily later this year, and has a fourth co-host, Aisha Harris.
  • In a world where we are so dependent on our phones, our computers and the internet, what happens when you don’t protect yourself online? Criminal Domain is a new podcast from Ampel, talking to victims of cyber crime in a podcast presented by NortonLifeLock.
  • Fraudsters explore scams that have made millions and the fraudsters behind them, like Enron and Jim Bakker. A Spotify Original, hosted by Seena Ghaznavi and Justin Williams, it's from the guys behind The Last Podcast on the Left.
  • From scooters to last-mile delivery, ride-sharing to smart infrastructure, we might be in the next great mobility revolution. City Talks, the newest podcast from the Ford Motor Company, takes a look at new trends.
  • Comes A Time is a new music interview series with Dead & Company and The Allman Brothers Band bassist Oteil Burbridge, and comedian Mike Finoia. Their guest today is Grateful Dead drummer Mickey Hart.
  • Talking Tales from Tulika is a new Spotify Original show for kids in India. The podcasts launch today, in English, Hindi, and Tamil, and feature characters from popular childrens' books from Tulika Publishers.

item.description:
Budden has a number of complaints against the company. And, Apple Watch to be removed from podcast stats.
Visit https://podnews.net/update/joe-budden-leaves-spotify for all the links, and to subscribe.
item.content:encoded:
Visit https://podnews.net/update/joe-budden-leaves-spotify for all the links, and to subscribe.

  • Joe Budden won't re-sign his exclusive Spotify deal, according to his latest episode. In a 114 minute segment, he complains variously that he has been "pillaged" by the company, that he didn't like the host-read advertising and refused to do any, that he wasn't paid a bonus that he believed he was entitled to, that he wasn't allowed any vacation, and that Bill Simmons called him to question why he'd taken time off when his father was ill. We've a rough machine transcript of his comments. Billboard reports that Budden was offered a significantly larger deal by Spotify, which he declined.
  • The IAB Tech Lab has released a guidance notice about Apple Watches resulting in inflated podcast numbers. We reported this behaviour on June 12. Any downloads to the Apple Watch will "no longer be counted toward any totals reported for the podcasting industry" from October 1. Legitimate downloads from Outcast, an Apple Watch app, may now be invisible to podcast hosts.
  • NBC Universal spent $822,000 on podcast advertising in July says Magellan AI: the company was promoting their new Peacock streaming service.

  • The Bello Collective interviews Carolina Guerrero and Daniel Alarcón, who came up with the idea for Radio Ambulante - and highlights the growing audience for Spanish language podcasts in the US.
  • Produce an Arabic podcast? Dubai-based Finyal Media is running a talent hunt to join their network.
  • Yesterday, we said that the first podcast sponsorship from Chevrolet was with Blue Wire Media. It wasn't (though it's a good client to have) - here's a sponsored podcast from Chevrolet in April 2016. Sorry.

  • Also from WGBH, All Rev'd Up - where faith intersects politics and culture - is back for a new season. The first episode is with Kamala Harris, as the first Black woman on a presidential ticket.

  • Spotify has revealed the "Top podcasts of the summer", based on number of listeners from June 1 - August 15th, 2020.   • Exclusive: Michelle Obama may be the #1 global podcast: but what was the #1 podcast, by total listeners, in the US? Or the UK? Or another 56 countries? We've got all the data - everywhere from Belgium to Bolivia. (This is based on listeners - not downloads - during this ten week time period).

item.title: Podcasting: 'more trustworthy than traditional media'
item.description:
The pandemic means more people listening to podcasts for information, not just entertainment
Visit https://podnews.net/update/trusst-in-mee for all the links, and to subscribe.
item.content:encoded:
Visit https://podnews.net/update/trusst-in-mee for all the links, and to subscribe.

  • First look: Podcasting is seen as more trustworthy than traditional media coverage of the current pandemic, according to new research published by Media Monitors today. The research also suggests that the pandemic has meant many listeners now use podcasts for information as well as entertainment.
  • Audible has unveiled new pricing for a new subscription podcast service. Audible Plus will offer access to exclusive Audible podcasts for US$7.95/month. (Luminary charges $4.99/month for their subscription service). Audible's Rachel Ghiazza apparently clarifies to The Verge that the platform is developing podcast content, but isn’t pulling them in from third-party RSS feeds. Confusingly, Podnews reported that Audible, and Amazon Music, have emailed podcasters to get them to submit their RSS feeds for a forthcoming service.
  • How accurate is geo-targeting by IP for podcasting? Bryan Barletta delves into the technology, and highlights that this is a big opportunity for Spotify to benefit from tighter targeting that's unavailable to the rest of us.

- 1 Can't Miss Event of 2020

  • US culture website Vulture is to "double their podcast coverage" according to a release. HotPod will now be published in Vulture; Nick Quah will also produce a new weekly podcast recommendation newsletter 1.5x Speed.
  • Quality beats quantity in podcast advertising, according to an article in Built In. Westwood One and Signal Hill Insights have released data showing podcast advertising drives brand equity.
  • Podpraat reports that Podcastfestival in the Netherlands is now selling tickets for their "offline conference" - yes, an actual physical conference, in Amsterdam in September. One session is in English; the others are advertised in Dutch (though Wil Williams won't be speaking Dutch, we presume - dat zou heel indrukwekkend zijn!).
  • How has podcast listening has been affected by quarantine? Edison Research has a free webinar this Thursday.
  • Привет! Bonjour! Apple is hiring for a Podcasts Editor in Moscow, and another in France. (More Podjobs)
  • Super-exciting user-agent corner After we suggested it, Podlink is now correctly setting the useragent of its RSS crawler, greatly helping podcasters who use their universal links. PodTail has also set their own RSS crawler's useragent, thus allowing better monitoring of their browser-based podcast player; and universal link supplier Podfollow is also correctly setting their RSS user-agent after Podnews got in touch. Google Podcasts is also fixing a bug in its Android app, which we spotted was not giving a correct useragent for automated downloads. If our traffic is anything to go by, that means an extra 20% of downloads correctly attributed to Google Podcasts. Find all the useragents in this Github repo.

Thank you to YaYa Podcasting's Carrie Caulfield Arick for becoming our latest personal supporter. "You create the sound," they say, "we'll take care of the noise." We're grateful to Carrie for her support: it's helped us focus on some HTML tweaks to our website to continue speeding it up. Here's how to support us.

  • My Amazing Body, from Queensland Health, is back for a second season. The podcast explores interesting, unknown and misunderstood parts of your body, featuring interviews with medical experts and stories from Queensland in Australia.

item.content:encoded:

  • Anchor is hosting a large number of pirated podcasts from other publishers, we can reveal today. 30% of all the Podtrac top 20 podcasts are currently being copied on Anchor, according to our searches. The new podcast from NYT/Serial, Nice White Parents, has a further five pirated copies hosted on Anchor, using the original artwork.

    • Because podcasts hosted on Anchor are not subject to the normal Apple Podcasts approval process, these pirated copies are instantly appearing in searches using Apple Podcasts and Spotify, and apps that use that data, like Overcast and Pocket Casts. Many of the copies have enabled Anchor's Listener Support, to gain financially from their copies. None of these plays will be credited back to the original owner; and ads will not earn the publishers revenue.
  • Podcast host Libsyn has published a positive Q2 2020 financial report. While revenue from advertising and LibsynPro decreased during the worst months of the pandemic, total podcasting revenue was up by 10.6% in the second quarter. Laurie Sims has been promoted to COO, and a strategic review has recently concluded. The company now hosts 74,000 podcasts; and April was the second-highest month in the company's history for signups. Libsyn also owns Pair, an internet hosting company.

Podnews is using this data to monitor podcast players that do not send proper useragents themselves, like TuneIn, and to supply different versions of our audio to different platforms.

Tips and tricks

  • For Podnews, Jason DeFillippo has written How I make... Grumpy Old Geeks for Podnews - lots of detail about microphones, post-production and distribution. Learn from a podcast with more than 460 episodes and "a few million downloads"
  • How to get universal links to your podcast for everyone looks at different services making it easy to link to your podcast.

(Want to write a "How I make..." for us? We're at editor@podnews.net)

Podcast News

  • In The John Bartolo Show Sarah Jane Rodriguez stops in to discuss all things 2nd amendment and her recent move into the non profit world. Listen now
  • Sir, this is a Wendy's podcast is a new podcast from Wendy's, a US fast food retailer. It appears to consist of a sponsor message, followed by the same offer read slightly differently.
  • Forgive me! is a new podcast sitcom from Rogue Dialogue Productions in Syracuse NY, USA. The comedy explores the lives of a small town catholic church through confession.
  • The podcast Imaginary Advice is 'drugs for your ears', says Timber Media.
  • Fan of the late-70s early-80s band Talking Heads? This Must Be Talking Heads is an album-by-album exploration on their work, hosted by Rodney Gordon and linked from here.
  • Fan of the late-70s early-80s band Talking Heads? U Talkin' Talking Heads 2 My Talking Head is an album-by-album exploration on their work, hosted by comedians Adam Scott and Scott Aukerman and linked from here.
